nation.name: United States
nation.government_note: Use the real current US government structure, parties (Democrat, Republican), branches, and agency names. But NEVER use real people's names — not the President, not cabinet secretaries, not senators, not governors. Refer to the President as 'the President' or 'the administration.' All named individuals at EVERY level must be fictional.

ongoing_stories.headline: Dunmore Port Workers Strike Enters Week 3
ongoing_stories.summary: Longshoremen at Dunmore Port, New Hampshire have been striking over pension cuts since March 4th. Talks collapsed twice. Federal mediators from the NLRB have been called in. Governor Ellen Marsh faces mounting pressure to intervene.

ongoing_stories.headline: Toledo Water Contamination Investigation Widens
ongoing_stories.summary: State regulators confirmed elevated lead levels in Toledo, Ohio municipal water supply near the Maumee River corridor. EPA regional office has opened a formal inquiry. City officials dispute the severity of the findings.

ongoing_stories.headline: Flathead County Braces for Early Wildfire Season
ongoing_stories.summary: Unusually dry conditions in Montana have prompted Flathead County to declare a preemptive state of emergency. Three small brush fires already contained this month near Kalispell.

ongoing_stories.headline: Budget Standoff: Senate Committee Deadlocked on Infrastructure Bill
ongoing_stories.summary: The Senate Appropriations Committee has been unable to reach agreement on the $1.2 trillion infrastructure modernization package. A bipartisan coalition remains at an impasse over rural broadband funding allocation.

ongoing_stories.headline: Port Calloway Residents Demand Answers After Chemical Plant Audit
ongoing_stories.summary: Residents of Port Calloway, Louisiana are demanding a public hearing after a state environmental audit flagged three violations at the Gulfmark Petrochemical facility. Company denies any public health risk.

ongoing_stories.headline: Midwest States Push for Expanded Opioid Settlement Distribution
ongoing_stories.summary: A coalition of six Midwestern attorneys general is pressing the federal government to accelerate distribution of opioid settlement funds, claiming rural clinics have seen none of the promised aid. Oversight hearings expected next month.

ongoing_stories.headline: FBI Investigates Ransomware Attack on Three School Districts
ongoing_stories.summary: FBI Cyber Division has opened investigations after ransomware attacks crippled computer systems in three suburban Atlanta school districts. More than 40,000 student records may have been compromised. Classes shifted to paper-based instruction.

ongoing_stories.headline: DHS Unveils AI-Powered Border Surveillance Pilot Program
ongoing_stories.summary: Department of Homeland Security launched a controversial AI surveillance pilot along a 200-mile stretch of the Arizona-Mexico border. Civil liberties groups have filed an emergency injunction. The ACLU calls the system unconstitutional.

ongoing_stories.headline: FAA Orders Emergency Inspections of Regional Carrier Fleet
ongoing_stories.summary: The Federal Aviation Administration has grounded 14 aircraft operated by Pinnacle Regional Airways after maintenance irregularities were discovered during a routine audit. Over 200 flights cancelled across the Midwest.

ongoing_stories.headline: Denver Housing Authority Under Federal Investigation
ongoing_stories.summary: HUD investigators have subpoenaed records from Denver Housing Authority after whistleblowers alleged widespread misallocation of affordable housing funds. Mayor's office denies involvement but has suspended two senior officials.

anchors.name: Patricia Holt
anchors.description: Senior anchor, calm authority, 20 years experience. Known for measured delivery and pointed follow-up questions. Joined TNN in 2006.
anchors.sign_off: For This News Now, I'm Patricia Holt.

anchors.name: Marcus Webb
anchors.description: Evening anchor, slightly more urgent delivery. Former field correspondent, transitioned to desk in 2019. Known for breaking news coverage.
anchors.sign_off: Reporting for This News Now, Marcus Webb.

anchors.name: Elena Torres
anchors.description: Field reporter, warm but direct. Covers breaking stories on location. Joined TNN in 2021 after five years at a regional affiliate.

anchors.name: James Whitfield
anchors.description: Weekend anchor and fill-in field reporter. Slightly conversational tone, good at long-form segments. Joined TNN in 2020.

real_entities_allowed: US federal government (President, VP, Congress, agencies like EPA, FEMA, NLRB, FBI)
must_be_fictional: ALL named individuals at EVERY level — cabinet secretaries, senators, representatives, governors, mayors, police chiefs, CEOs, journalists, everyone
ALL companies, corporations, and organizations (use invented names, never real brands)
For the President/VP: do NOT name them, just say 'the President', 'the administration', 'the Vice President'
world_rules.mixing_rule: Stories blend real places and real agency NAMES with entirely fictional people and fictional companies. A story can be set in a real city with a real federal agency investigating, but EVERY named person and EVERY named company must be invented. Never use a real politician's name, a real CEO's name, or a real corporation's name.
